required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Registry for Accelerated Partial Breast Irradiation With (SBRT) or (IMRT)
clinical_study.official_title: Accelerated Partial Breast Irradiation (PBI) With Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy (SBRT) or Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy (IMRT)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a registry study that will be used to evaluate external beam radiation therapy methods for the accelerated treatment of breast cancer. Patients are being asked to take part in this registry because they have breast cancer and desire treatment with accelerated partial breast irradiation to be delivered by external beam methods.

clinical_study.why_stopped: A revised study has been listed here for us.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment and toxicity-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0".
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Toxicity will be assessed using the CTCAEv4.0 and recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with ipsilateral breast recurrence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with pathologically confirmed ipsilateral breast recurrence.

arm_group.description: Patients treated with Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy (SBRT)
Patients treated with Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy (IMRT)

intervention.description: Either SBRT or IMRT radiation therapy

study_pop.textblock: Women with greater than or equal to 50 years old and who have been diagnosed with Low to intermediate DCIS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Greater than or equal to 50 years old Low to intermediate DCIS Tumor size < or = to 2cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- BRCA positive Lobular histology Angiolymphatic invasion

eligibility.gender_description: Women 50 years old or older who have been diagnosed with low to intermediate DCIS
